longtext: One of the keys to a foolproof carbonara is to gather all of your ingredients.
You need everything within arm's reach.
So when I cook my pasta, I'm not waiting for anything.
I'm using Parmesan cheese and I'm using Pecorino.
I like to use a microplane for this.
For carbonara, I like my eggs to be room temperature.
At this point, I wanna add a little bit of my toasted black peppercorns.
Grating your own cheese is super important.
I like to use a microplane for this.
For carbonara, I like my eggs to be room temperature.
I'm going to use three whole eggs and two egg yolks.
The next thing I'm gonna do is I'm gonna mix my eggs and cheese together.
Let's just take the cheese, dump it into the eggs and we can just get this together.
At this point, I wanna add a little bit of my toasted black peppercorns.
When this cheese melts, I want it to be nice and fine.
If they're cold, that's gonna slow everything down.
The yolk is a lot of fat and the white is a lot of liquid.
By adding the extra yolk, I'm adding more fat to the dish, more richness to the dish.
We wanna get this into a nice homogenous mixture so that when we actually add the pasta to it, we don't get scrambled eggs.
If you can get it, go for the best cheese you can find.
I like to use a microplane for this.
For carbonara, I like my eggs to be room temperature.
I'll set them on the counter for about a half hour before I make the dish.
The mixture looks nice and creamy.
It's come together.
There's no bits of eggs or bits of cheese that aren't mixed in.
This is super important getting your carbonara to the right finished texture.
